summary: This document is a summary of a call between a US Attorney's Office representative and Tracy Chapell, a senior paralegal at FedEx, regarding her upcoming testimony. The discussion focuses on logistics, her role, and FedEx's recordkeeping practices, particularly concerning how account information was created and maintained in the early 2000s, with verification done by IT personnel.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.context: A FedEx senior paralegal who has testified before and is discussing logistics and recordkeeping practices for an upcoming testimony, specifically regarding how account information was handled in the early 2000s.

persons.name: Melissa Gorlmey
persons.context: Identified as counsel for FedEx, mentioned in the context of the call summary.

connections.description: Melissa Gorlmey is identified as counsel for FedEx, where Tracy Chapell is a senior paralegal, indicating a professional legal relationship.

events.title: Call with Tracy Chapell
events.description: A call between a US Attorney's Office representative and Tracy Chapell to discuss logistics for her upcoming testimony and FedEx's recordkeeping practices from the early 2000s.

keyFacts: Tracy Chapell, a senior paralegal at FedEx, has testified before and is preparing to testify again regarding recordkeeping practices.
The discussion aims to understand how FedEx account information was created and maintained in the early 2000s, noting differences in systems but similar practices.
FedEx verified records for the government with assistance from IT personnel to confirm information from archives.
